She has 16 eggs per day.
She eats 3 for breakfast, so she has 16 - 3 = 13 eggs left.
She bakes muffins with 4 eggs, so she has 13 - 4 = 9 eggs left.
She sells the remaining 9 eggs for $2 each, so she makes $9 * 2 = $18.
The answer is 18.

A robe takes 2 bolts of blue fiber and half that much white fiber.
This means it takes 2 + (2 * 0.5) = 3 bolts in total.
The answer is 3.

He bought a house for $80,000.
He put in $50,000 in repairs.
This means he spent $80,000 + $50,000 = $130,000.
The house was worth $80,000, so after the repairs it is worth $80,000 * 1.5 = $120,000.
The profit is $120,000 - $130,000 = -$10,000.
The answer is -$10,000.

He runs 3 sprints 3 times a week.
Each sprint is 60 meters.
So he runs 60 * 3 * 3 = 540 meters a week.
The answer is 540.

Wendi has 20 chickens.
She gives each chicken 3 cups of feed.
So, she gives 20 * 3 = 60 cups of feed.
She gives 60 cups of feed in 3 meals.
So, in the final meal, she gives 60 / 3 = 20 cups of feed.
The answer is 20.

One glass costs $5.
Every second glass costs 60% of the price.
So, every second glass costs $5 * 0.6 = $3.
16 glasses cost 16 * $5 = $80.
But every second glass costs $3, so 16 glasses cost 16 * $3 = $48.
The answer is $48.

Toulouse has twice as many sheep as Charleston.
Charleston has 4 times as many sheep as Seattle.
So, Toulouse has 2 * 4 = 8 times as many sheep as Seattle.
Seattle has 20 sheep.
So, the total number of sheep is 20 + 8 * 20 = 88.
The answer is 88.

200 GB is 200 * 2 GB = 400 GB.
400 GB / 2 GB/minute = 200 minutes.
200 minutes / 60 minutes = 3 hours.
3 hours / 40% = 1 hour and 40 minutes.
1 hour and 40 minutes / 20 minutes = 6 times.
6 times = 6 restarts.
The answer is 6.

She works 40 hours per week.

For the last 5 hours, her hourly rate is 1.2 * $10 = $12.
She worked 45 hours this week.
So her earnings are 45 * $10 + 5 * $12 = $450 + $60 = $540.
The answer is $540.

The total number of downloads over the three months is 60 + 180 + 126 = 336.

This means she works 50 * 35 + 15 = 275 hours a week.
She gets paid $20 per hour to teach and $30 to be a cheerleading coach.
This means she gets paid 20 * 275 + 30 * 15 = $5500.

But as I pour it, I spill one liter of the orange drink.
So, I have 25 - 1 = 24 liters of drink.

So her son was born 31 - 6 = 25 years ago.

This means he sold 8 - 3 - 2 - 3 = 2 DVDs.

After burning from 1:00 PM to 5:00 PM, it will be 10 - 5 = 5 centimeters shorter.

He runs 60 miles a week.

This means he runs 3 * 60 = 180 miles a week.
The answer is 180 miles a week.

Ben's iPhone is 2 times older than Suzy's iPhone.
So Suzy's iPhone is 1 year old.

The dragon is 1000 feet away.

So, the javelin can be thrown 3 * 400 = 1200 feet.
1200 feet is more than 1000 feet, so the javelin can be thrown 1200 feet.

252 eggs per day.

The answer is $240.

So, in total it will be fed 180 + 360 = 540 cups of dog food.
One bag of dog food contains 110 cups.
So, in total she will use 540 / 110 = 5 bags of dog food.

Raymond does half as much laundry as Sarah.
Sarah does 4 times as much laundry as David.
So Sarah does 400 pounds of laundry.
Raymond does half of that, so he does 200 pounds of laundry.
David does 4 times as much laundry as Raymond, so he does 800 pounds of laundry.
The difference in the amount of laundry Raymond and David do is 200 - 800 = -600 pounds of laundry.
The answer is -600.

There were 30 cars on the motorway.

The number of cars that drove through in the first 15 minutes must have been 30 - 15 = 15 cars.
20 more cars drove through in the remaining 15 minutes.
The number of cars that drove through in the remaining 15 minutes must have been 20.
The answer is 15 + 20 = 35 cars.

In total she will have 80 - 40 = 40 potted plants.
The answer is 40.

Jerome had 4 friends who came to visit him on a certain day.
The first friend pressed on the doorbell 20 times before Jerome opened.
The second friend pressed on the doorbell 1/4 times more than Jerome’s first friend.
The third friend pressed on the doorbell 10 times more than the fourth friend.
The fourth friend pressed on the doorbell 60 times.
The doorbell made 20 + 1/4 * 20 + 10 * 60 + 60 = 180 doorbell rings.
The answer is 180.

He read 15 pages on Monday.
He has 4 more days to complete all his reading.
That means he has 4 * 15 = 60 pages to read.
He has to read 4 pages from his Science textbook, 20 pages from his Social Studies textbook, 7 pages from his History textbook and 8 pages from his Geography textbook.
So, he has to read 4 + 20 + 7 + 8 = 37 pages.
60 / 37 = 1.5.
The answer is 1.5.

In the second month, she collected 20 - 60 = -40 cards.
In the third month, she collected 2 * (60 + 40) = 120 cards.
In total she has 60 + 40 + 120 = 240 cards.
The answer is 240.

Publisher A pays Mark 5 cents per sentence.
Publisher B pays Mark twice as much as Publisher A, so Publisher B pays Mark 10 cents per sentence.
Mark edits 1000 sentences each week.
So, he makes 1000 * 5 = 5000 cents.
The answer is 5000 cents.
